message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

This paper deals with the classification of authors' texts using machine learning techniques, specifically naive Bayesian classifier and k nearest neighbors. The focus is on semantic analysis of English fiction texts, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). 

The paper also involves the use of vector space and frequency characteristics, which are common techniques in information retrieval (IR) and machine learning (ML). Hence, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely sub-categories. 

The paper also involves the analysis of individual author's style, which is a common topic in artificial intelligence (AI) and deep learning (DL). Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DL (Machine Learning) are also possible sub-categories.
